content:
FabricTransportSettings FabricTransportSettings Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.FabricTransport.Common
Assembly:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.dll

Settings that configures the FabricTransport communication.

Edit

In this Article

public class FabricTransportSettingsPublic Class FabricTransportSettings
Inheritance
ObjectObject
FabricTransportSettingsFabricTransportSettings

Inherited Members

System.Object

ToString()ToString()
Equals(Object)Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)Equals(Object, Object)

GetHashCode()GetHashCode()
GetType()GetType()
MemberwiseClone()MemberwiseClone()

Constructors

FabricTransportSettings() FabricTransportSettings()

Edit

Creates a new FabricTransportSettings with default Values.

public FabricTransportSettings()Public Sub New

Properties

KeepAliveTimeout KeepAliveTimeout

Edit

KeepAliveTimeout is provides a way to configure Tcp keep-alive option.

public TimeSpan KeepAliveTimeout { get; set; }Public Property KeepAliveTimeout As TimeSpan
Value
TimeSpan TimeSpan

KeepAliveTimeout as TimeSpan

Remarks

Default Value for KeepAliveTimeout Timeout is set as TimeSpan.Zero. which indicates we disable the tcp keepalive option. If you are using loadbalancer , you may need to configure this in order to avoid the loadbalancer to close the connection after certain time

MaxConcurrentCalls MaxConcurrentCalls

Edit

MaxConcurrentCalls represents maximum number of messages actively service processes at one time.

public long MaxConcurrentCalls { get; set; }Public Property MaxConcurrentCalls As Long
Value
Int64 Int64

MaxConcurrentCalls is the upper limit of active messages in the service.

Remarks

Defaults value for the MaxConcurrentCalls is to the Number of processors.

MaxMessageSize MaxMessageSize

Edit

MaxMessageSize represents the maximum size for a message that can be received on a channel configured with this setting.

public long MaxMessageSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxMessageSize As Long
Value
Int64 Int64

Maximum size of the message in bytes.

Remarks

Default Value for MaxMessageSize used is 4194304 bytes

MaxQueueSize MaxQueueSize

Edit

The maximum size, of a queue that stores messages while they are processed for an endpoint configured with this setting. 

public long MaxQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxQueueSize As Long
Value
Int64 Int64

Max Size for a Queue that recieves messages from the channel

Remarks

Default value is 10,000 messages

OperationTimeout OperationTimeout

Edit

Operation Timeout which governs the whole process of sending a message, including receiving a reply message for a request/reply service operation. This timeout also applies when sending reply messages from a callback contract method.

public TimeSpan OperationTimeout { get; set; }Public Property OperationTimeout As TimeSpan
Value
TimeSpan TimeSpan

OperationTimeout as TimeSpan

Remarks

Default Value for Operation Timeout is set as 5 mins

SecurityCredentials SecurityCredentials

Edit

Security credentials for securing the communication 

public SecurityCredentials SecurityCredentials { get; set; }Public Property SecurityCredentials As SecurityCredentials
Value
SecurityCredentials SecurityCredentials

SecurityCredentials as SecurityCredentials

Remarks

Default Value for SecurityCredentials is None SecurityCredential can be of type x509SecurityCredentail X509Credentialsor WindowsCredentials WindowsCredentials

Methods

LoadFrom(String, String, String) LoadFrom(String, String, String)

Edit

Loads the FabricTransport settings from a sectionName specified in the configuration file Configuration File can be specified using the filePath or using the name of the configuration package specified in the service manifest . It will first try to load config using configPackageName . if configPackageName is not specified then try to load from filePath.

public static FabricTransportSettings LoadFrom(string sectionName, string filepath = null, string configPackageName = null)Public Shared Function LoadFrom(sectionName As String, filepath As String = Nothing, configPackageName As String = Nothing) As FabricTransportSettings
Parameters
sectionName
String String

Name of the section within the configuration file. If not found section in configuration file, it will throw ArgumentException

filepath
String String

Full path of the file where the settings will be loaded from. If not specified , it will first try to load from default Config Package"Config" , if not found then load from Settings "ClientExeName.Settings.xml" present in Client Exe directory.

configPackageName
String String

Name of the configuration package.If its null or empty,it will check for file in filePath

Returns
FabricTransportSettings FabricTransportSettings

FabricTransportSettings

Remarks

The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the configuration file,to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transport settings.

  1. MaxQueueSize - MaxQueueSizevalue in long.
  2. MaxMessageSize - MaxMessageSizevalue in bytes.
  3. MaxConcurrentCalls - MaxConcurrentCallsvalue in long.
  4. SecurityCredentials - SecurityCredentials value.
  5. OperationTimeoutInSeconds - OperationTimeout value in seconds.
  6. KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds - KeepAliveTimeout value in seconds.

TryLoadFrom(String, out FabricTransportSettings, String, String) TryLoadFrom(String, ByRef FabricTransportSettings, String, String)

Edit

Try to load the FabricTransport settings from a sectionName specified in the configuration file. Configuration File can be specified using the filePath or using the name of the configuration package specified in the service manifest . It will first try to load config using configPackageName . if configPackageName is not specified then try to load from filePath.

public static bool TryLoadFrom(string sectionName, out FabricTransportSettings settings, string filepath = null, string configPackageName = null)Public Shared Function TryLoadFrom(sectionName As String, ByRef settings As FabricTransportSettings, filepath As String = Nothing, configPackageName As String = Nothing) As Boolean
Parameters
sectionName
String String

Name of the section within the configuration file. If not found section in configuration file, it return false

settings
FabricTransportSettings FabricTransportSettings

When this method returns it sets the FabricTransportSettings settings if load from Config succeeded. If fails ,its sets settings to null/>

filepath
String String

Full path of the file where the settings will be loaded from. If not specified , it will first try to load from default Config Package"Config" , if not found then load from Settings "ClientExeName.Settings.xml" present in Client Exe directory.

configPackageName
String String

Name of the configuration package. If its null or empty,it will check for file in filePath

Returns
Boolean Boolean

Boolean specifies whether the settings get loaded successfully from Config. It returns true when load from Config succeeded, else return false.

Remarks

The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the configuration file,to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transport settings.

  1. MaxQueueSize - MaxQueueSizevalue in long.
  2. MaxMessageSize - MaxMessageSizevalue in bytes.
  3. MaxConcurrentCalls - MaxConcurrentCallsvalue in long.
  4. SecurityCredentials - SecurityCredentials value.
  5. OperationTimeoutInSeconds - OperationTimeout value in seconds.
  6. KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds - KeepAliveTimeout value in seconds.
